intro: Solidago virgaurea var. humillima, commonly known as the dwarf goldenrod, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters, featuring slender, hairy stems and small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has alternate, linear to lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. This variety is distinguished by its compact size and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening for its attractive, golden floral display.
